cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 190 miles E of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving west then west-southwest toward the south-central Texas coast, well south of Louisiana
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Texas coast (Baffin Bay–Mesquite Bay area, near Corpus Christi)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch/Warning and Hurricane Watch/Warning confined to Baffin Bay to Sargent TX and Baffin Bay to Mesquite Bay TX
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Baffin Bay–Mesquite Bay TX; Tropical Storm Warning Mouth of Rio Grande–Baffin Bay and Mesquite Bay–San Luis Pass TX
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South-central Texas coast with secondary rainfall impacts extending to the upper Texas and Louisiana coasts
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: HIGH ISLAND TX (closest point with published probabilities)
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible (forecast 3–5 inches along upper TX & LA coasts)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: No (forecast 1–2 ft east of Sargent TX, minimal for Louisiana)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds unlikely at New Orleans (<5% chance)
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of around 1 ft possible along southeast Louisiana coast; not expected to exceed 3 ft
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could bring 3–5 inches with isolated higher pockets to southeast Louisiana Saturday into Sunday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents along Gulf beaches; isolated brief tornadoes possible overnight along upper TX and far SW Louisiana coast, but risk very low for New Orleans
